document.discussion_title: Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust (PEI) Upgraded by Zacks Investment Research to Buy
document.topic_text: Tweet Zacks Investment Research upgraded shares of Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust (NYSE:PEI) from a hold rating to a buy rating in a report issued on Tuesday morning. The brokerage currently has $27.00 target price on the real estate investment trust’s stock. According to Zacks, “PENNSYLVANIA R.E. INVEST. TR. is a real estate investment trust, engaged in acquiring and holding for investment interests in real estate. “ In other Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust news, CEO Joseph F. Coradino sold 33,000 shares of Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust stock in a transaction on Thursday, June 9th. The stock was sold at an average price of $22.29, for a total value of $735,570.00. Following the completion of the sale, the chief executive officer now owns 324,056 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $7,223,208.24. The transaction was disclosed in a filing with the SEC, which can be accessed through the SEC website . Also, EVP Andrew M. Ioannou sold 10,000 shares of Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust stock in a transaction on Thursday, June 9th. The stock was sold at an average price of $22.27, for a total value of $222,700.00. Following the completion of the sale, the executive vice president now directly owns 46,156 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $1,027,894.12. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . Several hedge funds have recently modified their holdings of PEI. BlackRock Fund Advisors raised its stake in shares of Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust by 0.5% in the first quarter. BlackRock Fund Advisors now owns 4,352,601 shares of the real estate investment trust’s stock valued at $95,104,000 after buying an additional 22,801 shares during the last quarter. BlackRock Institutional Trust Company N.A. raised its stake in shares of Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust by 2.2% in the first quarter. BlackRock Institutional Trust Company N.A. now owns 2,652,436 shares of the real estate investment trust’s stock valued at $57,956,000 after buying an additional 57,194 shares during the last quarter. State Street Corp raised its stake in shares of Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust by 3.0% in the first quarter. State Street Corp now owns 2,306,827 shares of the real estate investment trust’s stock valued at $50,405,000 after buying an additional 67,753 shares during the last quarter. JPMorgan Chase & Co. raised its stake in shares of Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust by 138.7% in the first quarter. JPMorgan Chase & Co. now owns 1,661,308 shares of the real estate investment trust’s stock valued at $36,300,000 after buying an additional 965,269 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Victory Capital Management Inc. raised its stake in shares of Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust by 12.8% in the fourth quarter. Victory Capital Management Inc. now owns 1,038,795 shares of the real estate investment trust’s stock valued at $22,718,000 after buying an additional 117,500 shares during the last quarter. Separately, Stifel Nicolaus raised Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust from a hold rating to a buy rating and set a $27.00 price objective for the company in a research report on Wednesday, April 20th. One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating and four have assigned a buy rating to the company. Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust has a consensus rating of Buy and a consensus target price of $25.50. Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust ( NYSE:PEI ) opened at 23.28 on Tuesday. The stock’s 50 day moving average price is $23.68 and its 200-day moving average price is $21.78. Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust has a 12 month low of $16.42 and a 12 month high of $25.67. The stock’s market cap is $1.62 billion. Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust (NYSE:PEI) last released its earnings results on Tuesday, July 26th. The real estate investment trust reported $0.43 EPS for the quarter, beating the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $0.41 by $0.02. During the same quarter in the previous year, the business earned $0.39 EPS. The firm earned $94.30 million during the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $68.46 million. The company’s revenue for the quarter was down 7.3% compared to the same quarter last year. Analysts anticipate that Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust will post $1.85 EPS for the current fiscal year. The business also recently disclosed a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Thursday, September 15th. Investors of record on Thursday, September 1st will be given a dividend of $0.21 per share. This represents a $0.84 dividend on an annualized basis and a yield of 3.61%. The ex-dividend date is Tuesday, August 30th. Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust (PREIT) is an integrated, self-managed and self-administered real estate investment trust (REIT). The Company has a primary investment focus on retail shopping malls located in the eastern half of the United States. It is engaged in the ownership, management, leasing, acquisition, redevelopment, development and disposition of shopping malls. Get a free copy of the Zacks research report on Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust (PEI) For more information about research offerings from Zacks Investment Research, visit Zacks.com Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust
